recipesList.name: Spicy Chicken Curry
recipesList.cookingMethod:
1. Mix yogurt, tomato paste, ginger-garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala in a bowl. 
2. Heat oil in a pan and sauté onion and red pepper until soft. 
3. Add the yogurt mixture and cook for 2-3 minutes. 
4. Add paneer and cook for another 5-7 minutes. 
5. Serve hot with rice or naan.
recipesList.description: Luchi and Chholar Dal - Luchi is a type of fried bread that is similar to puri, and is often served for breakfast or as a snack. Chholar dal is a dish made with split chickpeas, onions, garlic, ginger, and spices like cumin and coriander. It is a common accompaniment to luchi, and is often garnished with fresh cilantro

recipesList.name: Sesame Beef Stir Fry
recipesList.cookingMethod:
1. Mix yogurt, tomato paste, ginger-garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala in a bowl. 
2. Heat oil in a pan and sauté onion and red pepper until soft. 
3. Add the yogurt mixture and cook for 2-3 minutes. 
4. Add paneer and cook for another 5-7 minutes. 
5. Serve hot with rice or naan.
recipesList.description: Shrimp Bhuna - Shrimp bhuna is a spicy and flavorful shrimp curry that is made with plump and juicy shrimp, onions, tomatoes, ginger, and a blend of fragrant spices. The dish is cooked slowly until the shrimp is tender and the sauce has thickened, resulting in a rich and delicious flavor. It is often served with rice or flatbreads.

recipesList.name: Shrimp and Vegetable Lo Mein
recipesList.cookingMethod:
1. Mix yogurt, tomato paste, ginger-garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala in a bowl. 
2. Heat oil in a pan and sauté onion and red pepper until soft. 
3. Add the yogurt mixture and cook for 2-3 minutes. 
4. Add paneer and cook for another 5-7 minutes. 
5. Serve hot with rice or naan.
recipesList.description: Dal - Dal is a simple but delicious lentil soup that is a staple food in Bangladesh. It is made with red lentils, onions, garlic, and spices like turmeric and cumin. The dish is typically served with rice or flatbreads, and is often garnished with fresh cilantro.

recipesList.name: Crispy Orange Chicken
ingredients: salt and black pepper to taste
recipesList.cookingMethod:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. 
2. Combine garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, mint, salt, and black pepper in a bowl. 
3. Rub mixture all over the lamb chops. 
4. Roast lamb chops for 15-20 minutes, or until desired doneness. 
5. Serve hot with mint sauce.
recipesList.description: Beef Bhuna - Beef bhuna is a rich and spicy beef curry that is made with tender chunks of beef, onions, garlic, ginger, and a blend of fragrant spices. The dish is cooked slowly until the meat is tender and the sauce has thickened, resulting in a deep and complex flavor. It is often served with rice or flatbreads.

recipesList.name: Spicy Korean Beef Tacos

4. Roast lamb chops for 15-20 minutes, or until desired doneness. 
5. Serve hot with mint sauce.
recipesList.description: Fish Curry - As a country surrounded by water, fish is a staple food in Bangladesh. Fish curry is a popular dish that is made with fish (usually a local variety like Rohu or Hilsa), a flavorful curry sauce made with onions, tomatoes, ginger, and spices like cumin and coriander. The dish is often served with rice or flatbreads like roti or naan.

recipesList.name: Miso-Glazed Salmon
ingredients: salt and black pepper to taste

2. Combine garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, mint, salt, and black pepper in a bowl. 
3. Rub mixture all over the lamb chops. 
4. Roast lamb chops for 15-20 minutes, or until desired doneness. 
5. Serve hot with mint sauce.
recipesList.description: Biryani - Biryani is a fragrant and flavorful rice dish that is popular throughout Bangladesh. It is made with long-grain rice, a variety of spices, meat (often chicken or beef), and sometimes vegetables or eggs. The dish is traditionally served with a side of raita (yogurt sauce) and/or chutney.

recipesList.name: Tom Kha Gai Soup
ingredients: salt and black pepper to taste

2. Combine garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, mint, salt, and black pepper in a bowl. 
3. Rub mixture all over the lamb chops. 
4. Roast lamb chops for 15-20 minutes, or until desired doneness. 
5. Serve hot with mint sauce.
recipesList.description: Chicken Korma - Chicken korma is a creamy and mildly-spiced chicken curry that is a favorite in Bangladesh. It is made with tender chicken pieces, a fragrant curry sauce made with onions, garlic, ginger, and a blend of spices like cinnamon, cardamom, and cloves, and a generous amount of creamy yogurt or coconut milk

3. Rub mixture all over the lamb chops.

5. Serve hot with mint sauce.
recipesList.description: Beef Rezala - Beef rezala is a rich and flavorful beef curry that is made with tender chunks of beef, a fragrant and creamy sauce made with yogurt, nuts, and spices like cumin and coriander, and a touch of sweetness from raisins and sugar. The dish is typically served with rice or flatbreads.

recipesList.name: Chicken Tikka Masala

3. Rub mixture all over the lamb chops. 
4. Roast lamb chops for 15-20 minutes, or until desired doneness. 
5. Serve hot with mint sauce.
recipesList.description: Pitha - Pitha is a type of rice cake that is a traditional snack or dessert in Bangladesh. It is made with rice flour, coconut, and sugar, and is often flavored with cardamom or other spices. There are many different varieties of pitha, some of which are steamed, fried, or baked.

recipesList.name: Classic Spaghetti and Meatballs
ingredients: salt and black pepper to taste

3. Rub mixture all over the lamb chops. 
4. Roast lamb chops for 15-20 minutes, or until desired doneness. 
5. Serve hot with mint sauce.
recipesList.description: Shorshe Ilish - Ilish is a type of herring that is native to Bangladesh and is considered a delicacy. Shorshe ilish is a dish that features the fish cooked in a tangy and spicy mustard sauce, with flavors of onions, garlic, and green chilies. The dish is typically served with rice.

3. Rub mixture all over the lamb chops. 
4. Roast lamb chops for 15-20 minutes, or until desired doneness. 
5. Serve hot with mint sauce.
recipesList.description: Chotpoti - Chotpoti is a popular street food in Bangladesh that is made with mashed potatoes, chickpeas, and a tangy tamarind sauce. It is often served in a bowl or on a plate, and is topped with crunchy fried onions, cilantro, and sometimes boiled eggs.

5. Serve hot with mint sauce.
recipesList.description: Beef Kebab - Beef kebab is a popular grilled meat dish in Bangladesh, made with marinated chunks of beef that are skewered and grilled over charcoal. The marinade typically includes yogurt, garlic, ginger, and a blend of fragrant spices like cumin and coriander. The kebabs are often served with a side of salad and flatbreads like naan or roti.

recipesList.description: Bhaji - Bhaji is a popular street food in Bangladesh that is made by deep-frying batter-coated vegetables like onions, eggplant, and potatoes. The crispy and golden-brown bhajis are typically served with chutney or hot sauce.

recipesList.description: Mutton Tehari - Tehari is a fragrant and spicy rice dish that is popular in Bangladesh. Mutton tehari is a variation of the dish that is made with tender chunks of mutton, fragrant spices like cardamom, cinnamon, and bay leaves, and caramelized onions. The dish is typically served with a side of raita.

recipesList.description: Begun Bhaja - Begun bhaja is a simple but delicious dish made with slices of eggplant that are marinated in spices and shallow-fried until crispy and golden brown. It is often served as a side dish with rice or flatbreads.

recipesList.name: Classic Spaghetti and Meatballs

recipesList.description: Mughlai Paratha - Mughlai paratha is a rich and indulgent flatbread that is a popular street food in Bangladesh. It is made by stuffing a flatbread with a mixture of minced meat, eggs, and fragrant spices, and then shallow-frying until crispy and golden brown.

recipesList.description: Chingri Macher Malai Curry - Chingri macher malai curry is a popular Bengali dish made with jumbo prawns (chingri) cooked in a creamy coconut milk sauce. The sauce is flavored with fragrant spices like cardamom and cinnamon, and has a mild sweetness from the addition of coconut cream or milk. The dish is typically served with rice.
